input.name: Enable Events
input.narrative: Flag to indicate that events should be enabled / disabled on the attached instance - defaulted to True

output.name: handle
output.narrative: An integer which can be used to identify the created instance in subsequent actions

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the required workbook should be opened. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: File name
input.narrative: The path and name of the file which should be opened.

output.name: Workbook Name
output.narrative: The name used by Excel to identify the workbook - usually this is the file name (without the path).

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the workbook which should be closed resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which should be closed.

input.name: Save Data
input.narrative: True to save the data before closing the workbook; The default of False will discard any changes before closing the workbook.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the workbook should be created. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

output.name: Workbook Name
output.narrative: The name of the workbook that Excel has created - this can be changed using the "Save Workbook As" action

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet should be created. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook in which the sheet should be created - The default empty value indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the sheet which should be activated. The default empty text value indicates that the currently active sheet should be, er, activated, making this a no-op.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the specified collection should be written. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook within which the data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current workbook within the specified instance.

input.name: Collection
input.narrative: The collection containing the data which should be written to the worksheet.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet on which the given data should be written. The default empty value indicates the current sheet within the specified workbook.

input.name: Cell Reference
input.narrative: The reference at which the collection should be written.

input.name: Include Column Names
input.narrative: True to indicate that the column names from the collection should be written out as the first row; False to ignore the column names and just write out the data.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the workbook which should be saved resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which should be saved

input.name: Filename
input.narrative: The full path and filename to which the workbook should be saved.

output.name: New Workbook Name
output.narrative: The new workbook name which Excel will use to identify the workbook within the instance.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the worksheet which should be retrieved resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.

input.name: Workbook Name
input.narrative: The name of the workbook which contains the sheet required. The default empty text indicates the currently active workbook on the specified instance.

input.name: Worksheet Name
input.narrative: The name of the worksheet within the specified workbook which should be written to a collection. The default empty text indicates the currently active worksheet within the specified workbook.

input.name: Fetch Data With Method
input.narrative: The method used to fetch data from cells in the worksheet. Options include Text, Value, and Value2. The default indicates Value will be used.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The collection containing the data from the specified worksheet - the column IDs will be gleaned from the first row on the sheet being retrieved.

input.name: handle
input.narrative: The integer handle identifying the instance on which the workbook which should be closed resides. The default of zero indicates the currently active instance.
